questions.question: If all flowers are plants, and some plants are trees, which of the following must be true?
questions.explanation: We know all flowers are plants, so it must be true that some plants are flowers.

questions.question: Sarah will attend the meeting only if John attends. John did not attend the meeting. Which conclusion can be drawn?
options: Sarah did not attend the meeting
Sarah might have attended the meeting
John will attend the next meeting
questions.explanation: If Sarah attends only if John attends, and John didn't attend, then Sarah could not have attended.

questions.question: All lawyers are professionals. Maria is a professional. Therefore:
questions.explanation: Just because all lawyers are professionals doesn't mean all professionals are lawyers. Maria might be a lawyer or another type of professional.

questions.question: The author's primary purpose in the passage is to:
questions.explanation: Most LSAT reading passages aim to explain or describe a phenomenon or situation.

questions.question: If the library is open, then the bookstore is closed. The bookstore is open. Therefore:
questions.explanation: This is a contrapositive. If library open â†’ bookstore closed, and bookstore is open, then library must be closed.

questions.question: Every student who studies hard passes the exam. Tom passed the exam. Therefore:
questions.explanation: Studying hard is sufficient for passing, but not necessary. Tom might have studied hard or passed for another reason.

questions.question: No cats are dogs. Some pets are dogs. Therefore:
questions.explanation: If some pets are dogs and no cats are dogs, then some pets (the dogs) are not cats.

questions.question: Five people (A, B, C, D, E) sit in a row. A sits next to B. Which could be true?
options: A sits at one end and B sits at the other end
C sits between A and B
B and C are separated by exactly two people
questions.explanation: If A sits next to B, A could be in any position except at opposite ends from B. A sitting in the middle is possible.

questions.question: Either the report is accurate or it is misleading. The report is not misleading. Therefore:
options: The report is both accurate and misleading
questions.explanation: This is a disjunctive syllogism. If it's either A or B, and it's not B, then it must be A.

questions.question: All teachers are patient. Some patient people are musicians. Which must be true?
options: None of these must be true
questions.explanation: We can't determine any definite relationship between teachers and musicians from these statements.

questions.question: If it rains, the game is canceled. The game was not canceled. Therefore:
questions.explanation: Contrapositive: If game not canceled, then it did not rain.

questions.question: Most doctors recommend exercise. Dr. Smith is a doctor. Therefore:
options: Dr. Smith does not recommend exercise
questions.explanation: Since most (not all) doctors recommend exercise, it's probable but not certain that Dr. Smith does.

questions.question: Three books (X, Y, Z) are stacked. X is above Y. Z is above X. What is the order from bottom to top?
questions.explanation: Y is below X (X above Y), and X is below Z (Z above X), so: Y, X, Z.

questions.question: All birds have feathers. This animal has feathers. Therefore:
options: This animal might be a bird
This animal is not a bird
questions.explanation: Having feathers is necessary for being a bird but might not be sufficient. The animal might be a bird.

questions.question: If the temperature drops below freezing, the lake will freeze. The lake did not freeze. Therefore:
options: The temperature did not drop below freezing
The temperature might have dropped below freezing
questions.explanation: Contrapositive: If lake didn't freeze, temperature didn't drop below freezing.
